thread.title: Leaders in Innovative Technologies, Strategies and Processes Recognized as Excellence.Gov Finalists
thread.title_full: Leaders in Innovative Technologies, Strategies and Processes Recognized as Excellence.Gov Finalists

title: Leaders in Innovative Technologies, Strategies and Processes Recognized as Excellence.Gov Finalists
text:
[September 24, 2015] Leaders in Innovative Technologies, Strategies and Processes Recognized as Excellence.Gov Finalists 
The American Council for Technology and Industry Advisory Council (ACT-IAC ( News - Alert )), the premier public-private partnership in the government IT community, today announced the 30 finalists for its annual Excellence.Gov Awards. This prestigious program, which recognizes the best practices in the government's management and use of information technology, will announce the award winners on November 9, 2015 at the Arena Stage in Washington DC. 
Since 2001, Excellence.Gov has recognized over 300 outstanding government programs and their industry collaborators that have had measurable impact on supporting the government's mission. A panel of over 40 judges, chosen from senior government and industry IT executives, selected this year's outstanding finalists. 
The following are the finalists for the 2015 Excellence.Gov Awards: 
Finalists for Customer Experience and Digital Service: City and County of San Francisco - The San Francisco Business Portal U.S. General Services Administration - Federal Risk Authorization and Management Program (FedRAMP) Internal Revenue Services - IRS Direct Pay Texas Department of Information Resources - Texas.gov US Census Bureau - Digital Transformation U.S. Patent Trade Office -The Patents End to End Project 
Finalists for Excellence in Intergovernmental Collaboration: Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Office of Cybersecurity and Communication (CS&C) -Federal Virtual Training Environment (FedVTE) Department of Treasury, Internal Revenue Service - Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) Global Information ( News - Alert ) Technology Forum Federal Bureau of Investigations - Next Generation Identification GSA- 18F U.S. General Services Administration - Government-wide Strategic Solutions (GSS) for Desktops and Laptops Maine Department of the Secretary of State - Rapid Renewal - Maine's Online Vehicle Registration Renewal Service Utah.Gov - Fiscal Note Agency Response 
Finalists in Excellence in Enterprise Efficiency: Department of Energy/Oak Ridge National Laboratory - Research Eterprise Solution (RESolution) Project U.S. Internal Revenue Services - Integrated Enterprise portal (IEP) Program National Oceanic ( News - Alert ) AA - N-Wave U.S. Social Security Administration - Enterprise Computer Storage Modernization Program U.S. Department of the Interior, Bureau of Indian Affairs - Extending the Useful Life of the National Information Management System (NIIMS) U.S. Department of Agriculture - One USDA U.S. Environmental Protection Agency - Electronic data eXchange and Evaluation System (EXES) Finalists in Excellence in Analytics & Big Data: U.S. General Services Administration - Digital Analytics Program U.S. General Services Administration - Acquisition Gateway ( News - Alert ) Office of the New York City Comptroller - Checkbook NYC U.S. Department of the Interior, Geological Survey - USGS Community for Data Integration (CDI) U.S. Patent Trade Office - Assignment Search 
Finalists in Excellence in Workforce/Mobility: U.S. Department of Justice, Alcohol and Tobacco Tax and Trade Bureau , Office of the Chief Information Officer - Virtual Desktop Infrastructure U.S. Department of Transportation - Pre-Employment Screening Program (PSP) U.S. General Services Administration - Enterprise Mobility Program U.S. Internal Revenue Services - Enterprise Electronic Facsimile (EEFax) 5479 Federal Emergency Management Agency - Disaster Management eGov Initiative 
Gigabyte Sponsors for the 2015 Excellence.Gov awards include Accenture ( News - Alert ), AT&T, CenturyLink and HP. For more information or to register for the awards event, please contact Marietta Allen at (703) 208-4800 Ext. 207 or visit the ACT-IAC web site here . 
About ACT-IAC - Advancing Government Through Education, Collaboration and Action 
ACT-IAC is the premier public-private partnership in the government IT community and an example of how government and industry work together. ACT-IAC is a nonprofit educational organization created to advance government through collaboration and education. The organization provides an objective, vendor and technology-neutral and ethical forum where government and industry are working together to develop innovative strategies, effective and efficient solutions and best practices. Headquartered in the Greater Washington, D.C. area, ACT-IAC also has chapters in Pacific region (based in San Diego) and the Rocky Mountain region (based in Denver). 
Learn more about our organization and how to become a member at http://www.actiac.org or call (703) 208-4800. Connect with ACT-IAC on Facebook , Twitter and LinkedIn . View source version on businesswire.com: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150924005121/en/
